intro: Mentha hyptiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Mentha hyptiformis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its aromatic leaves and flowers make it a valuable plant for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
